intro: Galium stojanovii f. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to regions of eastern Europe and western Asia, often found in moist meadows and woodland edges. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
